Summary Mary Triana's research interests include workplace discrimination and diversity, organizational justice, and human resources selection. She has taught courses on Team Dynamics, Personnel Staffing/Selection, Organizational Behavior, and Human Resources. She has professional work experience as a technical lead and project manager in Human Resources Information Systems and is both PMP (Project Management Professional) and SPHR (Senior Professional in Human Resources) certified. She has taught courses on Team Dynamics, Personnel Staffing/Selection, Organizational Behavior, and Human Resources. She has professional work experience as a technical lead and project manager in Human Resources Information Systems and is both PMP (Project Management Professional) and SPHR (Senior Professional in Human Resources) certified. Mary Triana's research interests include workplace discrimination and diversity, organizational justice, and human resources selection. She has taught courses on Team Dynamics, Personnel Staffing/Selection, Organizational Behavior, and Human Resources. Experience Associate Professor The University of Wisconsin - Madison July 2008  – Present (7 years 2 months) Madison, Wisconsin Area Job duties include research, teaching, and service. 
 
Research: I have authored a number of peer-reviewed publications in high quality journals such as Personnel Psychology, Organization Science, Journal of Organizational Behavior, Journal of Applied Psychology, Journal of Management Studies, Journal of Vocational Behavior, Journal of Business Ethics, Journal of Business and Psychology, Human Performance, Journal of Occupational and Organizational Psychology, Journal of Managerial Psychology and others. 
 
Teaching: I currently teach Leading and Working in Teams, The Management of Teams and Personnel Selection. I have taught both courses at the undergraduate and master's levels. I have executive education teaching experience in the area of team dynamics. I have also taught Organizational Behavior and Human Resources. 
 
Service: I currently serve as the Director of the Strategic Human Resources Center at the University of Wisconsin - Madison and chair the Diversity Committee for the Wisconsin School of Business. I previously served a three-year term on the University Compensation Committee, which advocates for compensation and benefits for university faculty and staff. I also served on my department's PhD committee for three years. Since 2008, I have represented the Wisconsin School of Business at the PhD Project, an organization that recruits qualified minority candidates to consider getting PhD degrees in business. PhD Candidate Texas A&M University 2004  –  2008  (4 years) Research
